questionnaire.name: 2. theBIKEnet Context - Where and with what you move

sections.title: theBIKEnet Context Questionnaire
sections.description:
üö≤ theBIKEnet is a public research project that explores how people cycle and move through cities - combining science, technology, and everyday experience. Our goal is to make urban mobility safer, fairer, and more sustainable for everyone.

This second questionnaire focuses on your living and travel context: where you usually move, what vehicles you can access, and how easily you can park or store them. Understanding these daily conditions helps us identify barriers, needs, and opportunities for cycling and micromobility in different parts of the city.

Participation is completely voluntary and anonymous. The information you provide will be used only for scientific and educational purposes.

Learn more about the theBIKEnet project

sections.title: Territorial Context
sections.description: Questions about the area you live in or travel through most often, and any local spots you find unsafe or uncomfortable.

questions.text: Which Municipio of Rome do you travel in most frequently? (You will be able to indicate other frequent areas next)

options.text: I don't know the number of Municipio

questions.text: Which is the second Municipio you travel in most frequently?

options.text: I don't know the number of Municipio

questions.text: Which is the third Municipio you travel in most frequently?

options.text: I don't know the number of Municipio

questions.text: Which of the following situations do you consider unsafe for cycling or using e-scooters in your area, even if you do not use them yourself?

options.text: Poor road surface or obstacles (e.g. potholes, debris)
Poor visibility (e.g. blind spots, parked vehicles blocking the view)
Conflicts with parked cars (e.g. opening doors, sudden movements)

sections.title: Household and Personal Mobility Resources
sections.description: What transport options and vehicles are available in your household.

questions.text: How many bicycles/e-bikes are available in your household (including yours)?
Which other vehicles are available in your household?
When a motor vehicle (car or motorbike) is available in your household, how easy is it for you to use it when you need it?
Do you currently hold a valid driving license (for car or motorcycle)?

options.text: Yes, car license (Category B or equivalent)
Yes, motorcycle or scooter license (Category A or equivalent)
Yes, both car and motorcycle licenses
No, I've never held a driving license
No, I do not currently hold a valid driving license

questions.text: Which of the following vehicles do you personally have regular access to for your trips?

sections.title: Parking
sections.description: Where and how you usually park your bicycle or e-scooter, and how easy or difficult it is.

questions.text: Do you have a private or reserved parking space for a car at your place of residence?

options.text: Yes, included in my residence (e.g. private or shared garage, reserved parking space)
Yes, but in a paid parking facility not included in my residence
No, I rely on street or public parking
I do not have access to a car

questions.text: Where do you usually store your bicycle or e-bike at your place of residence?

options.text: In a private or reserved bicycle parking space included in my residence (e.g. private or shared garage, bike room, cellar)
In a paid bicycle parking facility not included in my residence (e.g. bike box, private garage, secure bike parking)
Inside my apartment (no dedicated bike parking space)
In public bicycle parking spaces (e.g. bike racks)
In public spaces not specifically designed for bicycle parking (e.g., poles, railings)
I do not own or keep a bicycle or e-bike

questions.text: When you park or retrieve your bicycle or e-bike at your residence, how much physical effort does it usually require, considering the weight and handling of the vehicle you use most often?

options.text: No effort at all (easy ground-level access)
Some effort (short ramp, small step, or manual gate)
High effort (need to lift or carry the bike frequently)
I do not park a bicycle or e-bike at home

questions.text: Do you have parking available at your workplace or study location?

options.text: Yes, secure parking for bicycles or e-scooters
I do not work/study outside home

questions.text: When visiting places you go to frequently (e.g. shops, friends), how easy is it to find parking for a car nearby?

options.text: Not applicable (I do not use a car)

questions.text: When visiting places you go to frequently (e.g. shops, friends), how easy is it to find parking for a bicycle or e-scooter nearby?

options.text: Not applicable (I do not use a bicycle or e-scooter)

en.#2. theBIKEnet Context - Where and with: 2. theBIKEnet Context - Where and with what you move
en.#üö≤ <b>theBIKEnet</b> is a public rese:
üö≤ theBIKEnet is a public research project that explores how people cycle and move through cities - combining science, technology, and everyday experience. Our goal is to make urban mobility safer, fairer, and more sustainable for everyone.

This second questionnaire focuses on your living and travel context: where you usually move, what vehicles you can access, and how easily you can park or store them. Understanding these daily conditions helps us identify barriers, needs, and opportunities for cycling and micromobility in different parts of the city.

Participation is completely voluntary and anonymous. The information you provide will be used only for scientific and educational purposes.

Learn more about the theBIKEnet project

it.#2. theBIKEnet Context - Where and with: 2. Contesto di mobilit√† theBIKEnet ‚Äì Dove e con cosa ti muovi
it.#üö≤ <b>theBIKEnet</b> is a public rese:
üö≤ theBIKEnet √® un progetto di ricerca pubblica che studia come le persone si muovono nelle citt√†, combinando scienza, tecnologia ed esperienza quotidiana. Il nostro obiettivo √® rendere la mobilit√† urbana pi√π sicura, equa e sostenibile per tutte le persone.

Questo secondo questionario si concentra sul tuo contesto abitativo e di spostamento: dove ti muovi abitualmente, a quali veicoli hai accesso e quanto √® facile parcheggiarli o custodirli. Comprendere queste condizioni quotidiane ci aiuta a individuare barriere, bisogni e opportunit√† per la mobilit√† ciclistica e la micromobilit√† in diverse aree della citt√†.

La partecipazione √® completamente volontaria e anonima. Le informazioni fornite saranno utilizzate esclusivamente a fini scientifici ed educativi.

Scopri di pi√π sul progetto theBIKEnet
it.#Questions about the area you live in or: Domande sull‚Äôarea in cui vivi o ti sposti pi√π spesso e su eventuali luoghi che percepisci come insicuri o scomodi.
it.#In which Municipio of Rome do you curre: In quale Municipio di Roma vivi attualmente?
it.#Which Municipio of Rome do you travel i: In quale Municipio di Roma ti sposti pi√π frequentemente? (Potrai indicare altre aree frequentate nelle domande successive)
it.#Which is the second Municipio you trave: Qual √® il secondo Municipio in cui ti sposti pi√π frequentemente?
it.#Which is the third Municipio you travel: Qual √® il terzo Municipio in cui ti sposti pi√π frequentemente?
it.#I don't know the number of Municipio: Non conosco il numero del Municipio
it.#Which of the following situations do yo: Quali delle seguenti situazioni consideri insicure per andare in bicicletta o usare un monopattino elettrico nella tua zona, anche se non li utilizzi personalmente?
it.#Poor road surface or obstacles (e.g. po: Fondo stradale in cattive condizioni o presenza di ostacoli (es. buche, detriti)
it.#Poor visibility (e.g. blind spots, park: Scarsa visibilit√† (es. angoli ciechi, veicoli in sosta che ostacolano la visuale)
it.#Poor lighting, especially at night: Illuminazione insufficiente, soprattutto nelle ore notturne
it.#Conflicts with parked cars (e.g. openin: Conflitti con veicoli in sosta (es. apertura delle portiere, movimenti improvvisi)
it.#Conflicts with pedestrians: Conflitti con persone che si muovono a piedi
it.#Conflicts with other micromobility user: Conflitti con altre persone che utilizzano mezzi di micromobilit√†
it.#Household and Personal Mobility Resourc: Risorse di mobilit√† personali e del nucleo familiare
it.#What transport options and vehicles are: Quali mezzi di trasporto e veicoli sono disponibili nel tuo nucleo familiare.
it.#How many bicycles/e-bikes are available: Quante biciclette o e-bike sono disponibili nel tuo nucleo familiare (inclusa la tua)?
it.#Which other vehicles are available in y: Quali altri veicoli sono disponibili nel tuo nucleo familiare?
it.#When a motor vehicle (car or motorbike): Quando nel tuo nucleo familiare √® disponibile un veicolo motorizzato (auto o moto), quanto √® facile per te utilizzarlo quando ne hai bisogno?
it.#Sometimes difficult (shared or limited): A volte difficile (uso condiviso o limitato)
it.#Do you currently hold a valid driving l: Possiedi attualmente una patente di guida valida (per auto o motocicli)?
it.#Yes, car license (Category B or equival: S√¨, patente per auto (categoria B o equivalente)
it.#Yes, motorcycle or scooter license (Cat: S√¨, patente per moto o scooter (categoria A o equivalente)
it.#No, I've never held a driving license: No, non ho mai posseduto una patente
it.#No, I do not currently hold a valid dri: No, non possiedo attualmente una patente valida
it.#Which of the following vehicles do you: A quali dei seguenti veicoli hai accesso regolare per i tuoi spostamenti?
it.#Do you have a private or reserved parki: Hai a disposizione un parcheggio privato o riservato per auto presso la tua abitazione?
it.#Yes, included in my residence (e.g. pri: S√¨, incluso presso la mia abitazione (es. garage privato o condominiale, posto riservato)
it.#Yes, but in a paid parking facility not: S√¨, ma in una struttura a pagamento non inclusa nella mia abitazione
it.#No, I rely on street or public parking: No, mi affido al parcheggio in strada o in spazi pubblici
it.#Where do you usually store your bicycle: Dove custodisci di solito la tua bicicletta o e-bike presso la tua abitazione?
it.#In a private or reserved bicycle parkin: In uno spazio di parcheggio per biciclette privato o riservato incluso nella mia abitazione (es. garage privato o condominiale, locale bici, cantina)
it.#In a paid bicycle parking facility not: In una struttura di parcheggio per biciclette a pagamento non inclusa nella mia abitazione (es. bike box, garage privato, parcheggio sicuro)
it.#Inside my apartment (no dedicated bike: All‚Äôinterno dell‚Äôabitazione (senza uno spazio dedicato per la bicicletta)
In spazi pubblici dedicati al parcheggio delle biciclette (es. rastrelliere)
it.#In public spaces not specifically desig: In spazi pubblici non progettati specificamente per il parcheggio delle biciclette (es. pali, ringhiere)
it.#I do not own or keep a bicycle or e-bik: Non possiedo n√© custodisco una bicicletta o e-bike
it.#When you park or retrieve your bicycle: Quando parcheggi o recuperi la tua bicicletta o e-bike presso la tua abitazione, quanto sforzo fisico richiede di solito, considerando il peso e la maneggevolezza del mezzo che utilizzi pi√π spesso?
it.#No effort at all (easy ground-level acc: Nessuno sforzo (accesso facile a livello strada)
it.#Some effort (short ramp, small step, or: Poco sforzo (piccola rampa, gradino o cancello manuale)
it.#High effort (need to lift or carry the: Sforzo elevato (necessit√† di sollevare o trasportare spesso la bicicletta)
it.#I do not park a bicycle or e-bike at ho: Non parcheggio una bicicletta o e-bike presso la mia abitazione
it.#Do you have parking available at your w: Hai a disposizione un parcheggio presso il tuo luogo di lavoro o di studio?
it.#Yes, secure parking for bicycles or e-s: S√¨, parcheggio sicuro per biciclette o monopattini elettrici
it.#No, no dedicated parking available: No, non √® disponibile un parcheggio dedicato
it.#I do not work/study outside home: Non lavoro n√© studio fuori casa
it.#When visiting places you go to frequent: Quando ti rechi in luoghi che frequenti abitualmente (es. negozi, persone amiche), quanto √® facile trovare parcheggio per un‚Äôauto nelle vicinanze?
Quando ti rechi in luoghi che frequenti abitualmente (es. negozi, persone amiche), quanto √® facile trovare parcheggio per una bicicletta o un monopattino elettrico nelle vicinanze?
it.#Not applicable (I do not use a bicycle: Non applicabile (non utilizzo una bicicletta o un monopattino elettrico)
it.#Where do you usually store your bicycle: Dove custodisci di solito la tua bicicletta o e-bike presso la tua abitazione?
